static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.LayerClient newInstance(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID layerAppId, java.lang.String gcmSenderId)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Generates a new LayerClient, ready for authentication and sending messages.

returns.description: a new LayerClient, ready to authenticate.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context in which to create this client.

parameters.name: layerAppId
parameters.description: Layer-provided `App ID`, from the Layer Console.

parameters.name: gcmSenderId
parameters.description: Google Cloud Messaging `Sender ID` for receiving GCM pushes.

instance.name: getConversationIds
instance.comment:
Returns a list of all Conversation IDs.  Conversation objects can then be loaded by ID with
either the getConversation(id) or getConversations(ids) methods.  Such a combination can be
used to implement a lazy loading mechanism, such as an Adapter for a Conversation ListView.
The Adapter can be made dynamic by implementing a LayerChangeEventListener interface.

returns.description: a list of all Conversation IDs.

instance.name: getConversation
instance.comment: Returns the existing Conversation with the given ID, or `null`.

returns.description: the Conversation with the provided ID, or `null` if no such Conversation exists.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the unique identifier for the Conversation to return.

instance.name: getConversations
instance.comment: Returns a list of Conversations with the given IDs.

returns.description: a list of Conversations with the provided IDs, or an empty list if none are found.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: the unique identifiers for the Conversations to return.

instance.name: getConversations
instance.comment:
Returns all stored Conversations.  To preserve memory and enable a more responsive user
experience, consider using a combination of getConversationIds() and one of the get-by-ID
methods instead.

returns.description: a list of all Conversations.

instance.name: getConversationsWithParticipants
instance.comment: Returns a list of Conversations containing the exact set of participants (and no more).

returns.description:
a list of Conversations containing the provided participants, or an empty list if
none are found.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to find Conversations for.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void addParticipants(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Conversation conversation, java.util.List participants)
instance.name: addParticipants
instance.comment:
Adds participants to an existing Conversation.  Participants are user IDs from an external
server, for example the identity server used to generate `identity tokens`.

The addition of a participant can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on a conversation's "participants" attribute.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation to add a participant to.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to add.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void removeParticipants(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Conversation conversation, java.util.List participants)
instance.name: removeParticipants
instance.comment:
Removes participants from an existing Conversation. Participants are user IDs from an
external server, for example the identity server used to generate `identity tokens`.

The participant removal can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on a conversation's "participants" attribute.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation to remove a participant from.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to remove.

instance.name: deleteConversation
instance.comment:
Deletes a Conversation and all associated messages, both on this device and across all
participants in the Conversation.  Any in-memory representations will return `true` for
their isDeleted() method.

The deletion can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and listening for
DELETE events.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation to delete.

instance.name: sendMessage
instance.comment:
Sends a Message to its Conversation, synchronizing the Message among all participants in the
Conversation, as well as all other devices the authenticated user logs in on. Sending a
message queues the message for synchronization with the Layer Cloud.  Message.isSent() allows
monitoring of this message's synchronization status.

The `isSent` transitions can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on the "isSent" attribute.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the Message to send.

instance.name: markMessageAsRead
instance.comment:
Marks a Message as `read` and synchronizes the "read receipt" among all participants in the
Conversation, as well as all other devices the authenticated user logs in on.

Recipient status can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on the "recipientStatus" attribute.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the Message to mark as `read`.

instance.name: getMessageIds
instance.comment:
Returns an ordered list of IDs for Messages within a given Conversation.  Message objects can
then be loaded by ID with either the getMessage(id) or getMessages(ids) methods.  This
implements a lazy loading mechanism, useful in applications like an Adapter for a ListView of
a Conversation's Messages.  The Adapter can be made dynamic by implementing a
LayerChangeEventListener interface and handling INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE events.  The
returned list's order attempts to preserve a natural conversational ordering of Messages,
allowing this list to directly drive a Conversation's list of Messages in typical chat
applications.  Ordering is generated using a sequence-based algorithm rather than timestamps.

returns.description: the list of Message IDs within a Conversation, in conversational order.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation for which to retrieve Message IDs.

instance.name: getMessage
instance.comment: Returns a Message with the given ID, or `null` if no such Message is found.

returns.description: the Message with the given ID, or `null` if no such Message is found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the unique ID of the Message to return.

instance.name: getMessages
instance.comment: Returns a list of Messages with the given IDs, or an empty list of none are found.

returns.description: a list of Messages with the given IDs, or an empty list of none are found.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: the unique IDs of the Messages to return, or an empty list if none are found.

instance.name: getMessages
instance.comment:
Returns an ordered list of Messages within a given Conversation, in conversational order.
To preserve memory and enable a more responsive user experience, consider using a combination
of getConversationIds() and one of the get-by-ID methods instead.

returns.description: an ordered list of all Messages in the given Conversation.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation for which to retrieve Message IDs.

instance.name: deleteMessage
instance.comment:
Deletes a Message, both on this device and across all participants in the Conversation.  Any
in-memory representations of the Message will now return `true` on Message.isDeleted().

Message deletion can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and listening for
Message DELETE events.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the Message to send. to delete.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void setMetadata(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Message message, java.util.Map metadata)
instance.name: setMetadata
registerEventListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerChangeEventListener for observing change events.  Change events are emitted
for insertion, update, and deletion of Conversation and Message objects.  This allows a
listener to dynamically synchronize UI elements in the main thread or an external search
index in a background thread, for example.  Each emitted event contains a reference to the
target object.  Updates also contain the updated attribute, along with its old and new value.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerChangeEventListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterEventListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerChangeEventListener from listening for change events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerChangeEventListener to unregister.

returns.description: the ID for the current authenticated user, or `null` if not authenticated with Layer.

instance.name: authenticate
instance.comment:
Tells the client to begin authenticating with current credentials, if they exist.  If no
credentials exist, or the credentials are no longer valid, Layer will respond with a `nonce`
challenge provided to the LayerAuthenticationListener.onAuthenticationChallenge() listener
method. Respond to the challenge with LayerClient.answerAuthenticationChallenge(), providing
your externally-generated `identity token` (see the getting started guide).  You must have
connected with a call to connect() prior to authenticating.

instance.name: deauthenticate
instance.comment: Tells the client to drop all credentials and deauthenticate its session.

instance.name: answerAuthenticationChallenge
instance.comment:
Responds to a challenge from LayerAuthenticationListener.onAuthenticationChallenge().
Challenges may come at other times besides the authentication process initialized by a call
to `authenticate()`.  You must be ready to generate `identity tokens` in the background -
via an authenticated session with your backend or similar - to maintain an uninterrupted user
experience.

instance.name: registerAuthenticationListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerAuthenticationListener for observing authentication callbacks.
Authentication callbacks allow a listener to monitor authentication state and to respond to
authentication challenges.  This listener is required to complete authentication: the `nonce`
provided in onAuthenticationChallenge() must be used to generate the challenge's response, in
the form of an `identity token` provided to the LayerClient.answerAuthenticationChallenge()
method.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerAuthenticationListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterAuthenticationListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerAuthenticationListener from observing authentication events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerAuthenticationListener to unregister.

instance.name: connect
instance.comment:
Tells the client to connect to Layer, resuming a prior session, if it exists.  A prior
session exists if a call to getAuthenticatedUserId() returns a non-null value.  If no session
exists, or the session is no longer valid, the caller must start the authentication process
with a call to authenticate().

instance.name: disconnect
instance.comment: Tells the client to disconnect all network connections with Layer.

instance.name: registerConnectionListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerConnectionListener for observing connection callbacks.  Connection callbacks
allow a listener to monitor connection state with the Layer Cloud.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerConnectionListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterConnectionListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerConnectionListener from observing connection events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerConnectionListener to unregister.

instance.name: registerSyncListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerSyncListener for observing sync callbacks.  Sync callbacks let a listener
monitor the onset and completion of synchronization with the Layer Cloud.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerSyncListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterSyncListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerSyncListener from observing sync events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerSyncListener to unregister.

instance.name: setGcmSenderId
instance.comment:
Sets the Google Cloud Messaging `Sender ID` for this client.

To receive push notifications, create a BroadcastReceiver with an Intent filter for the
`com.layer.sdk.PUSH` action, as discussed in the Layer SDK getting started guide.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

instance.name: getAppId
instance.comment: Returns this client's Layer `App ID`.

returns.description: the Layer `App ID`.

derivedClasses.name: LayerClientImpl
derivedClasses.comment:
Design Philosophy:
(1) All Messaging-related tasks take place in AsyncTasks to keep networking off the main thread.
(2) SyncOps do not need special handling because they have their own thread pool.
(3) All public alerts happen through a Handler attacked to the UI thread to ease UI integration.

constructor.declarationSignature: public LayerChange(com.layer.sdk.changes.LayerChange.Type changeType, com.layer.sdk.messaging.LayerObject object, java.lang.String attributeName, java.lang.Object oldValue, java.lang.Object newValue)
constructor.name: LayerChange

instance.name: getObjectType
instance.comment: Returns the LayerObject.Type associated with this event.

returns.description: The LayerObject.Type associated with this event.

instance.name: getChangeType
instance.comment: Returns the LayerChange.Type associated with this event.

returns.description: The LayerChange.Type associated with this event.

instance.name: getObject
instance.comment: Returns the object associated with this event (Message or Conversation).

returns.description: The object associated with this event (Message or Conversation).

instance.name: getAttributeName
instance.comment: Returns the name of the updated attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.

returns.description: The name of the updated attribute.

instance.name: getOldValue
instance.comment: Returns the previous value of the changed attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.

returns.description: The previous value of the changed attribute.

instance.name: getNewValue
instance.comment: Returns the new value of the changed attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.

returns.description: The new value of the changed attribute.

classes.name: LayerChange
classes.comment:
Changes represent INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE actions applied to Layer Conversation and Message
objects.  INSERT and DELETE types contain a cached object reference to the object that was either
added or removed from the Layer persistence.  UPDATE types contain the cached object reference
along with a String representation of the attribute that changed, the attribute's old value,
and the attribute's new value.

instance.name: getClient
instance.comment: Returns the LayerClient that generated this LayerChangeEvent.

returns.description: The LayerClient that generated this LayerChangeEvent

instance.name: getChanges
instance.comment: Returns the list of Changes represented by this LayerChangeEvent.

returns.description: The list of Changes represented by this LayerChangeEvent

classes.name: LayerChangeEvent
classes.comment:
A LayerChangeEvent represents a list of Changes during foreground public API usage or background
synchronization.  These Changes can be used to synchronize UI state or an index within external
storage with dynamic Layer Conversation and Message object mutations.

constructor.declarationSignature: public LayerException(com.layer.sdk.exceptions.LayerException.Type type, java.lang.String detailMessage, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
constructor.name: LayerException

instance.declarationSignature: public void onSyncError(com.layer.sdk.LayerClient client, java.util.List exceptions)
instance.name: onSyncError

instance.declarationSignature: public void onAuthenticated(com.layer.sdk.LayerClient client, java.lang.String userId)
instance.name: onAuthenticated

static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Constructs a new Conversation with the provided participants.

returns.description: a Conversation ready for messages.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: List of participants to include in this Conversation.

instance.name: getId
instance.comment:
A unique identifier for this Conversation.  The identifier can change between a
locally-generated, temporary value and a globally-generated, permanent value.  Observers
(using LayerChangeEventListener) must listen for the "id" update to capture such identifier
migrations.

returns.description: a unique identifier for this Conversation.

instance.name: getParticipants
instance.comment:
Returns the set of user identifiers specifying who is participating in the conversation
modeled by the receiver.  Layer conversations are addressed using user identifiers of the
host application.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture participant addition and removal from a conversation
by listening for update events on the "participants" attribute.

instance.name: getLastMessage
instance.comment: The last message in this Conversation.

returns.description: the last message in this Conversation.

instance.name: isDeleted
instance.comment:
A conversation is considered `deleted` after LayerClient.deleteConversation() has been called
on it.  This will only appear on in-memory instances of a Conversation after it has been
deleted, either locally or remotely.  An attempt to load the conversation by ID will result
in `null` because it no longer exists. A registered LayerChangeEventListener can capture
the transition to isDeleted by monitoring for updates on the "isDeleted" attribute.  The
deletion of the conversation also results in a DELETE event.

returns.description: true if the Conversation is deleted; false otherwise.

classes.name: Conversation
classes.comment:
The `Conversation` class models a conversations between two or more participants within Layer. A
conversation is an on-going stream of messages (modeled by the `Message` class) synchronized
among all participants.

derivedClasses.name: Message
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Message` class represents a message within a conversation (modeled by the `Conversation`
class) between two or more participants within Layer.

derivedClasses.name: Conversation
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Conversation` class models a conversations between two or more participants within Layer. A
conversation is an on-going stream of messages (modeled by the `Message` class) synchronized
among all participants.

derivedClasses.name: Changeable
derivedClasses.comment:
The Changeable interface lets LayerClient track and alert object mutations that must get
propagated through the public API.  It is these changes which allow developers to synchronize
their UI and data store with the internal representation within SyncPersistence.

static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.messaging.MessagePart newInstance(java.lang.String mimeType, byte[] data)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Creates a MessagePart with the given MIME type and data.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: A MIME type identifying the type of data contained in the given data object.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to be embedded in the MessagePart.

static.name: newInstance
static.comment:
Creates a MessagePart with a string of text, encoded into a byte array in UTF-8 format.

This is a convenience accessor encapsulating the common operation of creating a message part
with a plain text data attachment in UTF-8 encoding. It is functionally equivalent to the
following example code:

MessagePart("text/plain", text.getBytes("UTF-8"));

returns.description:
A new message part with the MIME Type text/plain and a UTF-8 encoded representation
of the given input text.

parameters.name: plainText
parameters.description: The plain text body of the new message part.

instance.name: getMimeType
instance.comment: The MIME type of the content contained in the data portion of this MessagePart.

returns.description: the MIME type of the content contained in the data portion of this MessagePart.

instance.name: getData
instance.comment: The content of the MessagePart.

returns.description: a byte array of data representing the payload of this MessagePart.

classes.name: MessagePart
classes.comment:
The `MessagePart` class represents a piece of content embedded within a containing
Message. Each part has a specific MIME type identifying the type of content it contains.
Messages may contain an arbitrary number of parts with any MIME type that the application
wishes to support.

static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.messaging.Message newInstance(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Conversation conversation, java.util.List messageParts)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Constructs a new Message with the given Conversation and list of MessageParts.

returns.description: A new Message ready to send.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: The Conversation that this Message is associated with.

parameters.name: messageParts
parameters.description: A list of MessageParts to send with this Message.

static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.messaging.Message newInstance(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Conversation conversation, com.layer.sdk.messaging.MessagePart... messageParts)
static.name: newInstance

instance.name: getId
instance.comment:
A unique identifier for this Message.  The identifier can change between a locally-generated,
temporary value and a globally-generated, permanent value.  LayerChangeEventListeners can
listen for the "id" update to capture such identifier migrations, where the `oldValue` is the
temporary ID, and the `newValue` is the new, permanent ID.

returns.description: a unique identifier for this Message.

instance.name: getIndex
instance.comment:
Returns the conversational order of this Message within its Conversation.  Prior to sending,
the return value will be Integer.MAX_VALUE.

returns.description: the conversational order of this message, starting from 0 with the oldest message.

instance.name: getConversation
instance.comment: Returns the Conversation that the Message is a part of.

returns.description: the Conversation that the Message is a part of.

instance.name: getMessageParts
instance.comment:
Returns a list of message parts (modeled by the `MessagePart` class) that provide access to
the content of Message.

returns.description: this Message's list of MessageParts.

instance.name: isSent
instance.comment:
A message is considered `sent` after synchronization with the Layer Cloud..

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture the `isSent` transition by listening for deletes.

returns.description: `true` if this message has been deleted locally or remotely with deleteMessage().

instance.name: isDeleted
instance.comment:
A message is considered `deleted` after LayerClient.deleteMessage() has been called on it.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture the `deleted` transition by listening for deletes.

returns.description: `true` if this message has been deleted locally or remotely with deleteMessage().

instance.name: getSentAt
instance.comment: The date and time that the message was originally sent.

returns.description: the date and time that the message was originally sent.

instance.name: getReceivedAt
instance.comment:
The date and time that the message was received by the authenticated user, or `null` if they
are the sender.

returns.description:
the date and time that the message was received by the authenticated user, or `null`
if they are the sender.

instance.name: getSentByUserId
instance.comment: Returns the user ID of the user who sent the message.

returns.description: the user ID of the user who sent the message.

instance.name: getRecipientStatus
instance.comment:
Returns a dictionary keyed by the user ID of all participants in the conversation that the
message is a part of, and whose values are `RecipientStatus` representations of each
recipient's status.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture recipient status transitions by listening for updates
on the "receipt" attribute.

instance.name: getRecipientStatus
instance.comment:
Retrieves the message state for a given participant in the conversation.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture recipient status transitions by listening for updates
on the "receipt" attribute.

returns.description:
A `MessageState` value specifying the message state for the given participant or
`null` if the specified user is not a participant in the conversation.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to retrieve the message state for.

classes.name: Message
classes.comment:
The `Message` class represents a message within a conversation (modeled by the `Conversation`
class) between two or more participants within Layer.

enumClasses.name: RecipientStatus
enumClasses.comment: `RecipientStatus` is an enumerated value declaring the lifecycle states for recipient status.

static.declarationSignature: public static void broadcastPush(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID userId, android.net.Uri conversationId, android.net.Uri messageId, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String sound, com.layer.sdk.services.GcmIntentService.Origin origin)
static.name: broadcastPush
static.callSignature: broadcastPush(context, userId, conversationId, messageId, message, sound, origin)
static.comment:
Broadcasts an `com.layer.sdk.PUSH` Intent with:
- layer-push-message (String)
- layer-push-sound (String)
- layer-conversation-id (Uri)
- layer-message-id (Uri)

Does not broadcast if:
1. There is a known LayerClient

classes.name: GcmIntentService
classes.comment:
This {@code IntentService} does the actual handling of the Gcm message.
{@code GcmBroadcastReceiver} (a {@code WakefulBroadcastReceiver}) holds a
partial wake lock for this service while the service does its work. When the
service is finished, it calls {@code completeWakefulIntent()} to release the
wake lock.

static.name: register

static.declarationSignature: public synchronized static void unregister(java.lang.Object listener)
static.name: unregister

instance.name: onReceive
